page.title: 02DOWN SCHOOL
page.content:
{ The Down School}is situated in a rural area near Bridgnorth, once called Chetton Down.
The school has a population of{56} {children}with 3 teaching and 4 other staff. There are 3 classes; the infants are taught in the original building which was built in the last century, then below the infants class are the junior classes. These are demountable classes which get very hot in summer.
The teachers have frequent help from mothers, who take small groups. There is no school field so pupils use the farmers field next to or opposite the school for P.E. and games, if the grass is not too long. Swimming takes place weekly in Bridgnorth Leisure Centre.
